alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Park and northwestern Teton Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Entrance, or near West Yellowstone, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Madison, Harlequin Lake and Firehole Canyon around 410 PM MDT. Gibbons Falls around 415 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Twin Lakes, Grizzly Lake, Norris Junction, Virginia Cascade, Obsidian Cliff, Grebe Lake and Cascade Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
